article.headline: Northwestern St. 80, Lamar 66
article.story: NATCHITOCHES, La. (AP) -- Clifton Lee scored 12 points to lead Northwestern State to an 80-66 win over Lamar Thursday, sending the Demons to the Southland Conference championship game. Northwestern State, the tournament's top seed, will host second-seeded Sam Houston State Sunday. Sam Houston defeated Stephen F. Austin 78-72 in the other tournament semifinal game. The Demons (24-7) set a school record for most wins in a season with Thursday's win. Northwestern State will make its fourth appearance in the conference tournament finals in seven years under head coach Mike McConathy. Lamar (17-14) made just 33.3 percent of its shots in the game, making 23 of 69 field goal attempts. Alan Daniels provided the bulk of the Cardinals' offense with a game-high 34 points. Josh Goodwin also had 12 points for Lamar. The Demons outscored Lamar 48-30 inside the paint. Tyronn Mitchell and Luke Rogers had 10 points apiece for the Demons. Daniels kept Lamar in the contest as long as he could, cutting the Demon lead to eight, 50-42 with 12:50 to play. A 12-2 run got the Northwestern State lead to 62-44 after two Mitchell free throws with 7:52 remaining. Lamar was not able to get the lead under 10 for the remainder of the game.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
